Handwritten on back of photograph: ''20th Anniversary of Colorado Lodge 2271, B'nai B'rith. L-R Sonney Gershman, Harvey Friedentag, Harvey Olin, Charter members, holding constitution, #395.'' Handwritten on front of photograph: ''Mar 1980, 20th Anniversary, B'nai B'rith, Colorado, Lodge, #2271, Left to Right, Sonny Gershman, Harvey Friedentag, Harvey Olin, original charter members.''
Left to right Sonny Gershman, Harvey Friedentag, and Harvey Olin, original charter members of B'nai B'rith Colorado Lodge #2271, hold the charter of the lodge.
Donated by B'nai B'rith Colorado Chapter #2271.

oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Title supplied by archivist.

Handwritten on back of photograph: ''Phi Sigma Delta Fraternity, 1934 - Boulder Chapter - Theta, #387.'' Handwritten on paper with photograph: ''Phi Sigma Delta Fraternity, 1934 - Boulder Chapter - Theta, #387, Left to Right, Top Row - Edward N. Bronstein, Gerald Rosenblum, Philip Hornbein, Myron Goldberg, Harry H. Frumess, Milton Morris; Next to Top Row, Edward Pringle, Edward Mellicker, Irving Hayutin, Sam Rifkin, Leonard Leff, Richard Saliman, Louis Dubin; Next to Bottom Row, Sampson Knoll, Ray Katz, David Weinberg; Bottom Row, Alvin Lichenstein, Edmond Frank Graber, Joseph A. Eisenberg, Hyman Chester, Harold Gilman, Francis Reibscheid; Mascot - Romeo.''

A group of young men pose together on the steps of an unidentified building with an older man and a dog, their mascot named Romeo. Top row left to right, Edward N. Bronstein, Gerald Rosenblum, Philip Hornbein, Myron Goldberg, Harry A. Frumess, and Milton Morris. Next to top row left to right, Edward Pringle, Edward Mellicker, Irving Hayutin, Sam Rifkin, Leonard Leff, Richard Saliman, and Louis Dubin. Next to bottom row left to right, Sampson Knoll, Ray Katz, and David Weinberg. Bottom Row left to right, Alvin Lichenstein, Edmond Frank Graber, Joseph A. Eisenberg, Hyman Chester, Harold Gilman, and Francis Reibscheid.
Donated by Faye Greenberg Schayer
ph387
oai_dc:dc.dc:format: 1 item (photograph), 4 x 5 inches, black and white
oai_dc:dc.dc:rights: Copyright restrictions may apply. User is responsible for all copyright compliance.

oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Adolph Kiesler in Front of Peerless Smelting Works
Beck Archives Photograph Collection, Businesses
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Kiesler, Adolph,--1880-1967
Peerless Smelting Works (Denver, Colo.)
Peerless Alloy Company (Denver, Colo.)
Jewish men
Jewish businesspeople
Charities
Exterior views
Denver (Colo.)
West Colfax (Denver, Colo.)
Metal-workers
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Handwritten on top of page: "Scan Smelting Works #032."
Exterior view of Peerless Smelting Works at 2022 West Colfax Avenue in Denver, Colorado. Adolph Kiesler, standing in the center, started the Peerless Alloy Company in Denver in 1908.
Copy donated by Peggy Lehmann, granddaughter of Adolph Kiesler, for ''A Colorado Jewish Family Album.''
oai_dc:dc.dc:format: 1 item, (photograph), 3 x 4 inches, black and white
oai_dc:dc.dc:rights: Copyright restrictions may apply. User is responsible for all copyright compliance.

oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Celia Isaacs with Children, Sadie and Louis
oai_dc:dc.dc:relation: Beck Archives Photograph Collection, Families and Groups
oai_dc:dc.dc:format: 1 item (photograph), 8 x 5 inches, black and white
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Handwritten on back of photograph: ''#166 Celia Stasser Isaacs (changed to Stager upon immigration) with children Sadie and Louis c 1901''. On envelope: ''#166 Celia Stager Isaacs and children, c. 1901''.
Formal portrait of Celia (Stager) Isaacs posed behind a prop fence with her children Sadie and Louis.
Title supplied by archivist.
Appears in ''Images of America: Jewish Denver 1859-1940,'' by Dr. Jeanne Abrams, on page 116.
Donated by Charlotte Gold.

oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Morris and Zelda Averch Family Passover Seder
oai_dc:dc.dc:relation: Beck Archives Photograph Collection, Families and Groups
oai_dc:dc.dc:format: 1 item (photograph), 5 x 6 inches, black and white
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Typed caption in photo book: ''Zelda and Morris Averch Family Passover Seder, Denver, Colorado, 1932; L to R: Samuel Kaminsky, Estelle Kaminsky Levitt, Anna Averch Kaminsky, Eleanor Kaminsky Nasbarg, Zelda and Morris Averch, Stanley Averch, Dave and Verner Averch, Evelyn Averch, Eva Averch, Meyer and Estelle Averch Stine.; Courtesy: Estelle Levitt.''

The Morris and Zelda Averch family celebrate the Passover Seder with their children and grandchildren, including members of the Kaminsky family. From left to right, Samuel Kaminsky, Estelle Kaminsky (Levitt), Anna Averch Kaminsky, Eleanor Kaminsky (Nasbarg), Zelda and Morris Averch, Stanley Averch, Dave and Verner Averch, Evelyn Averch, Eva Averch, Meyer Averch and Estelle Averch (Stine). This is a copy of the original photograph.
Title supplied by archivist.
Donated by Estelle Kaminsky Levitt for publication in A Colorado Jewish Family Album.
Photo Book #142

oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Louis Robinson Family
oai_dc:dc.dc:relation: Beck Archives Photograph Collection, Families and Groups
oai_dc:dc.dc:format: 1 item (photograph), 4 x 5 inches, black and white
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Typed caption in photo book: ''Louis Robinson (seated center) and Family, c. 1907, Denver, Colorado; Courtesy: Robinson Dairy Inc.''
Louis Robinson sits on a chair, flanked by his wife and children. Louis Robinson established the first Robinson dairy farm in 1885.
Title supplied by archivist.
Appears in ''Images of America: Jewish Denver 1859-1940,'' by Dr. Jeanne Abrams, page 32.
Donated by Robinson Dairy Inc. for publication in A Colorado Jewish Family Album. A digital version donated by Richard and Edward Robinson in 2008.
PB34
